intro: Phyllorkis tripetala, commonly known as the three-lobed daisy, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with three distinct lobes, giving it its scientific name. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Phyllorkis tripetala thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or grassy areas.
